intro: Dissotidendron melleri var. melleri, commonly known as the Meller's dissotidendron, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. The flowers are clustered in inflorescences and are pollinated primarily by insects, contributing to its ecological significance in its native habitat.
